result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephanie S Cotton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
If revoked: Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to:

miscConds.notes: Court Costs and Buy Money to be paid as a Condition of Probation. (Buy money to go to Drug Metro Unit)
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
No contact with Robert Alvarez.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - With huber, release for work and counseling. COMMENCE 2/1/16 by 6 pm.

Defendant Stephanie S Cotton in court with Attorney Virginia m Stuller.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court discloses to parties that it recollects Defendant from the past when it was a prosecutor with the district attorney's office and recalls having charged Defendant in the past.  Court recuses.  Case to be re-assigned. NOTE:  Please contact Attorney Stuller before scheduling new date.
Sentencing hearing at 12-16-2015 10:30 am

Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 10:30 am.
